page.title: 10LANDSCAPE
page.content: I feel privileged to live in this beautiful place with fresh clean air and friendly people. Despite the rapid growth of houses and shops, life has not changed much. It is still possible to wander the tranquil miles of golden sands, and feel immense pleasure when you discover new plants growing in seemingly barren sand, pick up gnarled driftwood and beautiful sea shells, and gather a harvest of shrimps and shell fish. Yet the other side of the village is countryside where you can marvel at the birth of lambs in spring and watch cows grazing in the lush pastures. Camber is Shangri-La if you enjoy simple pl;easires like birds singing and butterflies dancing in the flowers.
